intro: Faradaya powellii, commonly known as Powell's faradaya, is a rare and striking plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh desert conditions. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
